title: How to Make a Jal‐Jeera

steps.headline: Prepare the herbs.
steps.description: Wash them, if needed, then chop them finely. Peel the ginger and chop roughly.

steps.headline: Blend the herbs with the ginger until they make a smooth paste.
steps.description: You can use a blender or a pestle and mortar. If you grind the herbs by hand, your end drink will have a rougher texture, but the same taste.

steps.headline: Put the herb mix into a large bowl.
steps.description: If you ground them by hand, stir in half a cup of water.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients to the mix and stir well.
steps.description: Put the Jal-jeera in the fridge to get cold. Leave it for 3 to 4 hours to allow the flavour to develop fully.

steps.headline: Serve over ice, garnished with mint leaves.

text: Prepare the herbs. Wash them, if needed, then chop them finely. Peel the ginger and chop roughly. Blend the herbs with the ginger until they make a smooth paste. You can use a blender or a pestle and mortar. If you grind the herbs by hand, your end drink will have a rougher texture, but the same taste. Put the herb mix into a large bowl. If you ground them by hand, stir in half a cup of water. Add the remaining ingredients to the mix and stir well. Put the Jal-jeera in the fridge to get cold. Leave it for 3 to 4 hours to allow the flavour to develop fully. Serve over ice, garnished with mint leaves.
